newsitem.title: USA: Florsheim lifted by cost control, sales.
newsitem.headline: Florsheim lifted by cost control, sales.

text.p: Florsheim Shoe Co, which earlier reported a third-quarter profit versus a loss, said Tuesday cost control, sales growth and margin improvement have lifted results this year.

"The improved operating results for the third quarter and nine months are attributable to our continuing focus on margin improvement, expense control, and sales growth" said Charles Campbell, chairman, president and chief executive.
Earlier, Florsheim posted a profit of $92,000, or $0.01 a share, for the third quarter compared with a loss of $1.3 million, or $0.16 a share, a year ago.
It was the first profitable quarter since the first quarter of 1995, the company said.
U.S. wholesale sales were up 7.5 percent during the quarter versus the same period last year, a significant increase compared with the first half trend, the company said.

Same-store sales, or sales among stores open a year, in the company's U.S. specialty stores fell 2.9 percent in the quarter. During the year-to-date period, same-store sales at the U.S. specialty stores were down 2.7 percent. International sales fell one percent in the quarter.
